body:
When running `gitk` generated by spack, I see the following error:
```
 % gitk
/scratch/vendors/spack.20170502/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/git-2.12.2-cduatp5pegjyiwvv6rfmpdaagp2hlmct/bin/gitk: line 3: exec: wish: not found
```

This can be remedied by:
1.  Creating a symlink in the `tk` bin directory: 
```
cd `spack location -i tk`/bin; ln -s wish8.6 wish
```
2. Loading the `tk` module when `git` is loaded.

I'm not sure how to automate this in spack.
title: gitk cannot find tk's wish program
